With Duskruin up and running, this is a good chance to boast. Low endroll crits, amusing moments, etc., etc. You know the drill, whip 'em out.

An announcer shouts, "Round 19, send in another one!"  An iron portcullis is raised and a grey-skinned hunter troll enters the arena!

[midnightarena]>watch 

You appraise the situation and notice the hunter troll may slam into you into a spiked wall, you could try to roll out of the way!

[midnightarena]>roll

You set yourself up to roll out of the hunter troll's way!

A grey-skinned hunter troll removes a plain wooden arrow from in her quiver.
A grey-skinned hunter troll fires a plain wooden arrow at you!
At the last moment, you block the missile with your pavis!
You manage to block with the exact angle needed to deflect the attack right back at the hunter troll!
AS: +503 vs DS: +118 with AvD: +14 + d100 roll: +10 = +409
 ... and hits for 115 points of damage!
 Shot destroys eye and the brain behind it!
A grey-skinned hunter troll blinks in astonishment, then falls flat on her face with a loud *THUD*.
The wooden arrow breaks apart and crumbles away.

You blink.

Mogonis
Sunday, August 20th, 2017, 3:01:44 AM

No. If you have a bandit bounty, and you deflect a bandit's ammo back at it and kill it without having hit it already, you don't get bounty credit for killing it.

Mogonis
Tuesday, August 22nd, 2017, 7:43:55 PM

I stopped berserking between champions. It's not worth it. I get through the critters by ambushing and berserking as a last resort. When a champion pops out, I quickly feint to drop its stance as well as gauge how tough it is. If my feint is low or fails, I'll tackle then berserk. If the feint is really successful, I'll berserk.

Ososis
Tuesday, August 22nd, 2017, 7:47:09 PM

@mogonis

Depends on how my brain is doing. Mush brain leads to more zerk slam.

post mortem disarm.. something something super effective

``` A human robber swings a handaxe at you! In the nick of time, you interpose your crimson eahnor pavis between yourself and the attack! You manage to angle your crimson eahnor pavis just right so that the human robber comes perilously close to the spikes on it!

* A spike on your crimson eahnor pavis jabs into the human robber! * ... 25 points of damage! Slash across back of hand, tendons sliced! The human robber falls to the ground and dies.

* As you block the blow, you suddenly pivot and slam your pavis into the human robber's handaxe! * [Roll result: 166 (open d100: 58) Bonus: 6] A solid strike! The human robber's handaxe is wrenched from his grasp! Roundtime: 2 sec.
